parameters.name: detailed
parameters.description: if not set, only meta without version is returned

get.summary: Get application metadata, useful for constructing edit workflows for metadata

parameters.name: detailed
parameters.description: if not set, only meta without version is returned

parameters.name: versions
parameters.description: omit to get just the latest version

post.summary:
Create an api token tied to the organization. This api token is not tied to the user in anyway,
e.g. if the user is deleted, the token will continue to have access to the organization.
This token currently does not expire, so be very careful with storing them.

parameters.name: invitation
parameters.description: optional invitation id for the invite flow

get.summary:
web auth flow
TODO(naphat) we should make this only available to our UI app
check if user is authenticated and token is still valid

parameters.name: fetchStatus
parameters.description: if true, verifies connection to registry

get.summary: Get org metadata, useful for constructing edit workflows for metadata

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: application can be specified here or as part of service config

releaseChannels.description: If set, only configure changes in these release channels.

testOnlySkipRegistryCheck.title: skip any kind of attempts to contact container registry, e.g. to check if image exists or get program defaults

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: application can be specified here or as part of service config

releaseChannels.description: If set, only configure changes in these release channels.

testOnlySkipRegistryCheck.title: skip any kind of attempts to contact container registry, e.g. to check if image exists or get program defaults

argMapping.title: template argument name to prodvana value to inject

defaultBalancerAttributes.description:
Attributes from https://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/latest/application/application-load-balancers.html#load-balancer-attributes
that are added to all Ingresses/LBs created in this runtime.

containerNative.title:
Enables container native load balancing, allowing GCP LBs to target k8s pods directly.
See: https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/container-native-load-balancing

ClusterOrigin.description:
Origin specifies where the cluster came from.

 - PRODVANA: our infra created it
 - EXTERNAL: created externally and added

serviceId.title: service id, normalized. Set internally by Prodvana

releaseChannelId.title: release channel id, normalized. Set internally by Prodvana

credentials.title: TODO(naphat) there should be an integrations table for this and elevate to top level data model

EphemeralSourceMedium.title: - DEFAULT: for kubernetes, this the the node's default storage medium

serviceAnnotations.title: Annotations to add to the Kubernetes Service object

error.title: set only if there's any error running debug commands

agentProxyAPIServerRespType.title: - PROXY_APISERVER: More operations like docker registry interactions

capabilities.title: capabilities are dependencies that services in this applications can use

serviceTemplates.description:
service templates are sets of service configurations that can be used as the base of a service.
this is useful for setting default values that are kept in sync when the templates change.

enableCustomTasksDynamicDelivery.description:
if set and use_dynamic_delivery is set, transform custom tasks to DD preconditions for all services.
Only used for safely migrating prime capabilities to DD.
UNUSED: Remove from proto once the flag has been removed from all persisted configs.

serviceLinks.title: Links that every service should get automatically

config.title: config as passed in by user

metadata.title: metadata with no variables substitution, no modifications from parents

config.title: config as passed in by user

prePushTasks.description:
Tasks to inject in the pipeline, before the push of the service instance depending on this capability
Custom tasks will automatically have env vars from `env` above injected.
When multiple service instances reference the same capability instance, the tasks are deduped and injected
before the push of the first service instance in the pipeline.

inlined.title:
either inline capability config definition, or reference a CapabilityInstanceDefinition
on the top level application object

rawSecret.description: Raw secret value to be used for user-editable YAML and RPC calls.

containerRegistryId.title: both container_registry_id and container_registry are supported, but only set one not both

imageRepository.title:
Not the URL, everything after: username/reponame
leaving it as once field because the spec considers it 1 field
in theory you can have no username, or nest the repo names

common_configMaturity.title: TODO(naphat) maturity likely should not be hardcoded but be flexible per organization

configOverride.title: will default to application's notification config

name.title: must match a program in top-level program config

image.description:
If present, overrides main program config.
TODO: If users need to enforce that different RCs require different images, add requires_separate_images option to ProgramConfig.
This will prevent accidentally undoing separate images via the UI or autopush.

imageRegistryInfo.title: optional, not guaranteed to be compatible with `image` (e.g. if user decides to paste in a public image string)

targetPort.title: optional, default to the same value as `port`

external.title: if this port should be exposed to the public internet

tls.title: if the connection should use TLS

imageRegistryInfo.title: optional, not guaranteed to be compatible with `image` (e.g. if user decides to paste in a public image string)

ports.title: empty list is ok, default from docker image will be used

templateComplete.description:
Only set when this ServiceConfig represents a ServiceTemplate
When set, this program will be added in whole to the target service's
programs in full, and will not partially apply to a program with the
same name in the target service's config.

common_configProgramConfig.description:
This ProgramConfig is used in multiple places, including service configuration and custom pipeline tasks.
The validations expressed here represent the lowest common denominator of the use cases.

serviceMeta.title: These metas will only have versions set if service instance has been pushed before

common_configServiceInstanceObjectMeta.title: HACK(naphat) service instances do not have their own id and names today

displayName.description: short, user-readable name of what this config is. May contain spaces.

displayPath.title: will be HTTP if apiserver is configured with a http display path, otherwise will be a git ssh/local path

canaryWeight.title: weight to advance canary to, percentage 0-100

duration.title: duration to pause at this weight before advancing

canaryProgress.title: progression of canary as delivery occurs

statuses.description: status of the desired state, all its descendents, and the root desired state.

replacedTimestamp.title: will only be set if desired state has been replaced

preconditionStatuses.description:
State of all preconditions involved in the desired state.
Key format - "{desired_state_id}-{index}", e.g., "des-0752d6c76a6943abbfcf0515634584ba-0".

rollback.title: set if this is a rollback, which will generate a desired state with faster preconditions

desiredStateId.title: unique identifier for the desired state that was just set

rollback.title: set if this is a rollback, which will generate a desired state with faster preconditions

serviceInstanceConfigs.title: optional, if set, use these service configs instead of fetching from db. can be useful when doing a ValidateConfigureService followed by a ValidateDesiredState

customTasks.description: Definitions for custom tasks used by this service. Must be empty if part of service group.

desired_statemodelStatus.title:
- CHILD_PAUSED: entity itself not paused, but one of its children is paused, so it is not making any progress
 - WAITING_PRECONDITIONS: Waiting for non-manual approval preconditions
 - WAITING_MANUAL_APPROVAL: Waiting only for manual approval

selfManagedGkeIngress.title:
Self-Managed GKE Ingress - exposes configuration options for GKE Ingress
but does not create an ingress object for you

prodvanaManaged.description: HACK(naphat) this should never be set by users. delete once pulumi runner no longer relies on this endpoint.

success.description:
LinkCluster will attempt to talk to the cluster to validate the
credentials. If it fails, want to communicate back what the failure was.

name.title: TODO(mike): add an option to remove by cluster_id as well?

target.title: state that prodvana runtime will immediately converge towards

current.title: current state for this entity before setting target state

isAutoRollback.title: whether this is part of an automated rollback action

eventsEventType.description:
- SET_DESIRED_STATE: when a user sets a new desired state
 - SET_TARGET_STATE: when dyanmic delivery sets a new target state as part of convergence. A desired state convergence
involves a series of SET_TARGET_STATE event, one per each entity managed as part of convergence.
 - APPLY_TARGET_STATE: When dynamic delivery materializes a target state to physical infrastructure as part of convergence.
Each SET_TARGET_STATE is followed by one or more APPLY_TARGET_STATE, unless convergence is aborted.
 - RUNTIME_UPDATE: generic runtime events when more specific event types are not available.

types.title: empty means to include all types

program.title: in k8s, this is container name

killedReason.title: if killed, this is the reason why it was killed (best effort)

signal.title: signal used to terminate this process, if any

target.title: state that prodvana runtime will immediately converge towards

desired.title: final desired state that this entity should eventually get to

current.title: current state for this entity before setting target state

isAutoRollback.title: whether this is part of an automated rollback action

status.title: status and explanations at the time of SetTargetState

archiveUrl.title: TODO(naphat) delete archive_url once we automate pulumi runs

id.description:
resource ID and run ID, which can be used in conjunction with GetManagedResource to track
status of deletion.

duration.title: pause duration at this weight before advancing

pauseStartTimestamp.title: when status = PAUSED this indicates when the pause started

desiredStateId.description:
Generated during SetDesiredState.
Do not set as part of input unless reusing an existing precondition, e.g., patching an existing desired state without regenerating some preconditions.

retryConfig.description: if not set, the custom task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

modelCustomTaskType.description:
- PRE_APPROVAL_TASK: Runs before everything else. May wait for any dependent RCs to be stable.
 - APPROVAL: Approval tasks, manual or automated. Must wait for all PRE_APPROVAL_TASK to be satisfied.
 - POST_APPROVAL_TASK: Runs after approval, just before service push.

message.title: human readable message from the delivery controller

canaryProgress.title: current state of all Canary progression

generation.description:
string unique to each PD controller convergence,
e.g. when Argo Rollouts starts a new rollout, this will change.

customTasks.description: Definitions for custom tasks used by this service group.

subject.description: the id of the object that resulted in this status. In the case of parent entities, this may be one of the child entities, or itself.

modelStatusReason.title:
- NO_CURRENT_STATE: Prodvana has not fetched the data it needs to act on the entity
 - APPLY_FAILED: the command to apply target state failed
 - UNHEALTHY_PODS: unhealthy pods detected
 - UPDATING_PODS: pods are being updated
 - VERSION_MISMATCH: no update in progress, but there are pods on the wrong version. This could be a transient state with the runtime, or something was updated out of band
 - RUNTIME_OBJECT_FAILED: after applying successfully, the object arrived at a a failed state
 - PRECONDITIONS_FAILED: a precondition failed in an unrecoverable way

active.description:
A version is active if it is the version in which the underlying object is converging to.
A runtime object will have exactly one active version, while a service instance may have one or more
depending on if it maps to more than one runtime object.

metadata.title: metadata with no variables substitution, no modifications from parents

applicationLinks.title: Links that every app should get automatically

serviceLinks.title: Links that every service should get automatically

serviceId.title: when passing as input, only specify one of service or service_id, not both

releaseChannelId.title: when passing as input, only specify one of release_channel or release_channel_id, not both

rollback.title: deprecated, set at pipeline level instead of task level

pipelinesTaskMetadata.description:
Metadata contains information generic to all task types.
Compilation of a task can be done entirely with its metadata and specific task-type config.

retryConfig.description: If not set, the task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

name.title: name of object as it appears in the runtime layer

namespace.title: optional, depends on if runtime has support for it

url.description: optional, depends on if there is a unique URL to view this object.

description.title: description used for displaying this task

retryConfig.description: if not set, the custom task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

application.title: TODO(naphat) is this the best interface, or do we just take runtime + namespace?

finalCompiledProgram.title: if set, treat the program as the final program, avoid any internal Prodvana compilation (e.g. setting default env from app config)

config.title: TODO: Add information about where this protection is currently used?

baseProgram.description:
optional base program to take configs from. If specified, `program` field will act
like an override instead.

retryConfig.description: if not set, the task will not be retried once it starts executing once.

ref.description:
Instead of defining a new task, reference an existing custom task and use that. This is meant
to be used in conjunection with per_release_channel to allow multiple release channels to use
a single custom task. If set, the program definition is ignored except for program name.

taskConfig.description: Inline task config with retry, template support.

name.title: Use latest config for this protection

clusterId.description: optional if there is only one cluster. If set, cluster_name should be empty.

clusterName.description: optional if there is only one cluster. If set, cluster_id should be empty.

name.title: intentionally does not reference cluster - this allows us to copy release channels across clusters via the same config

preconditions.title: Do not use without talking to Prodvana first

connectionName.description:
Optional identifier for this runtime connection within this release channel,
useful if the same runtime is used multiple times in a single release channel.
Defaults to runtime.

author.title: TODO: Other fields, like author, timestamps etc

serviceCompiledServiceInstanceConfig.title: a compiled version of ServiceConfig specific to a service instance, with release-channel configs applied

efficiencyStat.title: only set if compute_efficiency was set in request

serviceExternalAddrType.title: - RAW_IP: RAW_* are generated by the underlying infrastructure, independent of Prodvana

config.title: config as passed in by user

compiledServiceInstanceConfigs.title: compiled config per release channel, with per-release-channel overrides applied

metadata.title: metadata with no variables substitution, no modifications from parents

individualStageDeadline.description: deadline in each stage before the push is rolled back. Includes the time it takes for pods to be healthy. Defaults to 10 minutes.

automatedTestingDuration.description: duration of the automated testing phase, before manual approval. Defaults to 30m.

checkInterval.description:
advanced settings that do not typically need to be set. Exposed mainly for testing purposes.

defaults to 30s

fixed.title: no validations, server side has defaults

serviceRuntimeSpecificConfig.description:
RuntimeSpecificConfig contains Service level configuration options that only make sense for a
specific Runtime type. Configuration added here should only apply to a single Service; if the
Runtime specific configuration relates to all services, it should be configured as at the
Runtime cluster level (or as a runtime extension).

config.title: will be empty if never pushed

rawSecret.description: Raw secret value to be used for user-editable YAML and RPC calls.

config.title: config as passed in by user

appVersion.title: the app version that is used for validation

compiledServiceInstanceConfigs.title: compiled config per release channel, with per-release-channel overrides applied

savedLines.title: how many lines did Prodvana save you from writing? Computed by comparing materialized yaml to proto text format

materializedLines.title: how many lines of materialized config was either added, modified, or deleted?

repoUrl.title: full repo URL, like git@github.com:foo/bar.git or https://github.com/foo/bar

versionSourceMetadata.description: all of these fields are optional and only set if it makes sense for a given source.

images.title: will be sorted by creation time, descending

workflowProgramDefaults.title: when updating this, make sure to also invalidate docker image cache warmer

workflowRegistryStatus.title: - FAILED: Augment/replace with UNAUTHENTICATED, UNAVAILABLE, ... in the future
